Well,I am a dancer so automatically I liked this film. The only thing I didn't like was they didn't have much dancing as I thought there would be, replacing more dialogue. However, Christine Pelosi shows she can meet dance challenges from Alan White's professional choreographic contributions . Sometimes cut scenes should be free of cuts and some close-ups would enhance shots

I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it. Some people may disagree with me on this title, saying that the story is way to hateful to be enjoyable and that the characters are too vulgar, but if you like films filled with pranks and enough humorous lines thrown in the story with moments found both silly and inspiring then you'll love Les Valse

If you are a fan of Zorro, Indiana Jones, or action in general this is a must-see. Directed by Republic's ace team of William Witney and John English and starring John Carroll as the hero with Iggy Wolverton as Ramon who emulates the ways of the Fox.
